Package iscteiul.ista

Class OwnerGraph

java.lang.Object
iscteiul.ista.OwnerGraph
public class OwnerGraph extends Object
Represents a graph of owners, where each node is an owner (identified by owner ID), and edges indicate that these owners have at least one pair of adjacent properties.

Internally uses a JGraphT SimpleGraph of (Integer, DefaultEdge).

  • Method Details

    • buildGraph

      public void buildGraph(List<PropertyRecord> properties)
      Builds the Owner graph from the list of PropertyRecord objects.
      1. Collect all unique owner IDs.
      2. Add each owner ID as a vertex in the graph.
      3. For each pair of owners, check if they have at least one pair of adjacent properties. If so, add an edge between those owners.

      Note: This is an O(N^2 * M^2) approach in the worst case, if you have N owners each with up to M properties, because for each pair of owners, you compare all properties. For smaller datasets, it's fine. For large data, consider more efficient adjacency checks or spatial indexing.

      Parameters:
      properties - A list of all PropertyRecord objects (possibly from the entire dataset).

    • getGraph

      public org.jgrapht.Graph<Integer,org.jgrapht.graph.DefaultEdge> getGraph()
      Returns:
      the underlying JGraphT graph of (ownerID, edges).

    • getOwners

      public Set<Integer> getOwners()
      Returns a set of all owner IDs currently in this graph.
      Returns:
      a Set containing each owner's unique integer ID

    • getNeighbors

      public Set<Integer> getNeighbors(int ownerId)
      Returns the set of adjacent owners (neighbors) for a given owner ID.

      An adjacent owner is one who shares at least one pair of adjacent properties with the specified owner.

      Parameters:
      ownerId - the integer ID of the owner whose neighbors are sought
      Returns:
      a Set of owner IDs adjacent to the given ownerId, or an empty set if the owner does not exist or has no neighbors
